DataElement.preferredDefinition: A chronic systemic disease, primarily of the joints, marked by inflammatory changes in the synovial membranes and articular structures, widespread fibrinoid degeneration of the collagen fibers in mesenchymal tissues, and by atrophy and rarefaction of bony structures. Etiology is unknown, but autoimmune mechanisms have been implicated._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A chronic systemic disease, primarily of the joints, marked by inflammatory changes in the synovial membranes and articular structures, widespread fibrinoid degeneration of the collagen fibers in mesenchymal tissues, and by atrophy and rarefaction of bony structures. Etiology is unknown, but autoimmune mechanisms have been implicated._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A chronic systemic disease, primarily of the joints, marked by inflammatory changes in the synovial membranes and articular structures, widespread fibrinoid degeneration of the collagen fibers in mesenchymal tissues, and by atrophy and rarefaction of bony structures. Etiology is unknown, but autoimmune mechanisms have been implicated.

Concepts.definition: A chronic, systemic autoimmune disorder characterized by inflammation in the synovial membranes and articular surfaces. It manifests primarily as a symmetric, erosive polyarthritis that spares the axial skeleton and is typically associated with the presence in the serum of rheumatoid factor.

Property.preferredDefinition: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The cartilage along the articular surfaces of the bones may be attacked and destroyed, and the bone, articular capsule, and ligaments may begin to wear away (erode). These processes severely interfere with movement in the joint.

Concepts.definition: Arthritis associated with the destruction of the cartilage and the articular surface of the bone of the joint. This process severely interferes with movement in the joint.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rare condition that involves inflammation and necrosis of the walls of the blood vessels; may occur in rheumatoid arthritis.

Concepts.definition: A rare condition that involves inflammation and necrosis of the walls of the blood vessels; may occur in rheumatoid arthritis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The organ of sight or vision.

Concepts.definition: The organ of sight or vision.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated concept definition to use current NCIt. 4.5.18 mc

Concepts.definition: Relating to the lungs as the intended site of administration, where the pharmaceutical product is administered, usually by inhalation, for local action in the lower respiratory tract or for systemic action after absorption via the lower respiratory tract.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an area outside a joint.  In rheumatoid arthritis this term usually refers to tendonitis or inflammation of the heart or lung.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an area outside a joint.  In rheumatoid arthritis this term usually refers to tendonitis or inflammation of the heart or lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
